The giant panda ( Ailuropoda melanoleuca) is considered a National Treasure of China with the highest legal protection and dedicated recovery programs. Any emerging infection in giant pandas is of utmost importance because they may not have adequate immunity against the pathogen, implying that such infection may rapidly spread to other giant pandas, leading to large outbreaks and fatalities (
4 ). In this article, we describe a case of pH1N1 infection in a captive giant panda in an oceanarium in Hong Kong, China.
